cyclone.name: PETER
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ENE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest for a day or two, then turning northwest while passing north of the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall expected (center passes well north of Puerto Rico)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and the north-facing coasts of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) possible, mainly along exposed north-facing coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected, but long-period swells may cause dangerous surf and rip currents
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated higher totals possible, leading to localized urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents affecting port approaches and pilot-boarding areas
